isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - DESCRIPTION - SHIFT SELECTORS

svcprocinfo.para: With the lever selector, to move the shift lever (Figure 3) between "R," "N," and "D," a lockout must be disengaged by using the thumb release on the shifter handle. All other ranges can be selected by moving the lever without using the thumb release.
With the pushbutton selector, all of the ranges are selected by pushing the desired button. The transmission ECU will prevent selections that might damage the vehicle or cause a safety issue.

The shift selector is equipped with a digital display. In the operating mode, the display indicates the range selected. (The WTEC III controls no longer show both the range selected and the range obtained.)

The display has an LED to indicate MODE ON. This indicator has two meanings. In the normal operation of the transmission, it indicates that a secondary or special operating condition has been selected by the operator by depressing the MODE button. In the diagnostic mode, the MODE ON indicator means the displayed code is currently active. The transmission ECU is programmed to indicate the occurrence of a diagnostic code by illuminating the CHECK TRANS light.

The brightness control for the shift display illumination is controlled by the dash panel light control, through the ECU. The ECU monitors the voltage output of the vehicle panel light brightness control and if no voltage is sensed by the ECU, the shift selector is set to full intensity. If a lower than ignition voltage is sensed, the display is not fully illuminated. If full ignition voltage is sensed, the display is again lighted at full intensity.

svcsubproc.title: MODE BUTTON FUNCTION
svcsubproc.para: All shift selectors have a MODE BUTTON ( Figure 3). The button is used to activate special functions that have been programmed into the ECM or to perform system diagnostics when the vehicle is stopped. In a normal operating mode, the MODE status will be indicated by lighting "MODE ON" LED when the function is selected.

svcsubproc.title: SHIFT SCHEDULES
svcsubproc.para: PRIMARY - This shift schedule is used each time the vehicle is started. Typically this is used for normal vehicle operation.
SECONDARY - This is an alternate shift schedule that the ECU may use when requested. The operator must request the alternate shift schedule with the MODE button.
The control system logic protects the transmission from abuse. Such actions as full throttle neutral-to-range shifts and high speed direction changes are inhibited by the ECU.
